page.title: 20Port Penrhyn
page.content: Built by Lord Penrhyn,owner of the Penrhyn Slate Quarries at Bethesda some ten miles away,at the beginning of the 19th century,it is a small port built to accomodate the sailing ships of the time.They transported slates to many parts of the world.During the latter half of the century a narrow guage railway line was built from the quarry to the port and a network of lines covered the port itself.These linked up with the main railway and gradually killed off sea trade. With the final closure of the port for slate transportation the rails were removed during the late 1950's. The port is now used by small trawlers and by occasional coasters bringing building sand or taking away slate dust for construction purposes.
